title: Alejandro Mayorkas
added: As Alejandro Mayorkas is tapped to lead the third largest department, the Senate Republican Caucus to grill him on his past as a immigrant and his past as Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Alejandro Mayorkas could face his past in latest Senate hearing|url=https://www.rollcall.com/2021/01/15/alejandro-mayorkas-could-face-his-past-in-latest-senate-hearing/|access-date=2021-01-16|website=Roll Call|language=en}}</ref>

title: Alejandro Mayorkas
deleted: ===Nomination and confirmation hearings as Secretary of Homeland Security===

title: Alejandro Mayorkas
added: Secretary-designate Mayorkas has the support of the previous Secretary and of the Fraternal order of Police.{{citation needed}}

title: Alejandro Mayorkas
added: Born in [[Havana, Cuba]], his family fled during the [[Cuban Revolution]] to Florida and later settled in California.  After law school, Mayorkas worked as an Assistant United States Attorney and was appointed the [[United States Attorney for the Central District of California]] in Los Angeles during the administration of President [[Bill Clinton]].

title: Alejandro Mayorkas
added: Ultimately, Mayorkas was confirmed on a 56-43 vote. <ref>https://www.senate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?congress=117&session=1&vote=00012</ref>. Republican Senators [[Shelley Moore Capito]], [[Rob Portman]], [[Susan Collins]], [[Mitt Romney]], [[Lisa Murkowski]] and [[Dan Sullivan (U.S. senator)|Dan Sullivan]] voted with the Democrats to confirm Mayorkas. <ref>https://www.senate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?congress=117&session=1&vote=00012</ref>

title: Alejandro Mayorkas
added: Ultimately, Mayorkas was confirmed on a 56-43 vote. <ref>https://www.senate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?congress=117&session=1&vote=00012</ref> Republican Senators [[Shelley Moore Capito]], [[Rob Portman]], [[Susan Collins]], [[Mitt Romney]], [[Lisa Murkowski]] and [[Dan Sullivan (U.S. senator)|Dan Sullivan]] voted with the Democrats to confirm Mayorkas. <ref>https://www.senate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?congress=117&session=1&vote=00012</ref>
